metadata.title: CVE-2018-5249 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - untriaged
metadata.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Shaarli before 0.8.5 and 0.9.xbefore 0.9.3 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary code via the loginform's username field (aka the login parameter to the ban_canLogin functionin index.php).

criterions.comment: shaarli: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
